revised_title: Anatomy and Affinities of the Phyllirrho\#xEB; bucephala (Peron)
tldr: The author studied the anatomy and external characteristics of the Phyllirrho bucephala, a marine invertebrate species. They discovered that the species has a transparent body with a muscular system and a variety of pigments. The author also examined the digestive, circulatory, and reproductive systems, and discussed the species' affinities with other groups of animals, such as Gasteropods and Pteropods.
